Kasus Alfin Lestaluhu Jadi Pelajaran untuk Pelatih Timnas Indonesia U-19
01 Nov 2019, 17:47 by Bola.net
Bola.net - Punggawa Timnas Indonesia U-16, Alfin Lestaluhu meninggal dunia karena menderita sakit infeksi pada otaknya. Dia menghembuskan nafas terakhirnya di Rumah Sakit Harapan Kita, Jakarta, pada Kamis (31/10/2019) malam, pukul 22.11 WIB.
Sebelum dibawa PSSI ke Jakarta untuk dirawat, Alfin memang mengeluhkan sakit kepala selama berada di kampung halamannya, Tulehu, Ambon. Itu terjadi setelah dia menjadi korban Gempa Ambon pada 26 September lalu.
Kasus yang menimpa Alfin jadi pelajaran berharga bagi pelatih Timnas Indonesia U-19, Fakhri Husaini. Arsitek berusia 54 tahun ini berharap agar kedepannya tim nasional, khususnya bagian medis bisa mendeteksi gejala-gejala lebih cepat.
"Ini menjadi perhatian untuk tim nasional usia muda terutama, karena di setiap tim kelompok umur ada tim medis, ada dokternya. Kita berharap kasus Alfin ini, penyakit yang diderita Alfin ini paling tidak terdeteksi jauh-jauh hari, karena terlalu cepat juga ketika dia meninggal dari sudah tampil di kualifikasi Piala AFC, kemudian tampil di AFF juga, lalu uji coba, setelah itu dia sakit," ujar Fakhri di Stadion Pakansari, Cibinong, Kabupaten Bogor, Jumat (1/11).
"Tadinya saya berpikir dia sakit karena gempa. Ternyata ada penyebab lain. Menurut saya, seyogyanya jika di awal ada pemeriksaan medis, pengobatan bisa cepat yah. Tentu ini jadi pelajaran berharga buat manajemen tim nasional," katanya menambahkan.

The Alfin Lestaluhu Case Becomes Lessons for the U-19 Indonesian National Team Coach
Nov 01 2019, 17:47 by Bola.net
Bola.net - Indonesian National Team U-16 retainer, Alfin Lestaluhu died due to suffering from an infection in his brain. He exhaled his last breath at Harapan Kita Hospital, Jakarta, on Thursday (10/31/2019) night, at 22.11 WIB.
Before being brought by PSSI to Jakarta for treatment, Alfin did complain about a headache while in his hometown, Tulehu, Ambon. That happened after he became a victim of the Ambon earthquake on 26 September.
The case that befell Alfin became a valuable lesson for the Indonesian U-19 national team coach, Fakhri Husaini. The 54-year-old architect hopes that in the future the national team, especially the medical department can detect symptoms more quickly.
"This is a concern for the young national team especially, because in every age group team there is a medical team, there is a doctor. We hope that Alfin's case, Alfin's illness will be detected at least in advance, because he was too fast when he died. "from having appeared in the AFC Cup qualifiers, then appearing at AFF as well, then testing, after that he was sick," said Fakhri at Pakansari Stadium, Cibinong, Bogor Regency, Friday (1/11).
"At first I thought he was sick because of the earthquake. It turned out that there was another cause. In my opinion, it would be better if there was a medical examination at the beginning, treatment could be quick, of course. This would be a valuable lesson for the management of the national team," he added.
